t: For the director of music. Of the Sons of Korah. A psalm.
You,*pn Lord,*s showed favor to your land; you*ld restored the fortunes of Jacob.
You*ln forgave the iniquity of your people and*ld covered all their sins.
You*ln set aside all your wrath and*ld turned from your fierce anger.
Restore*pn us again, God our Savior, and*ld put away your displeasure toward us.
Will*ln you be angry with us forever? Will*ld you prolong your anger through all generations?
Will*ln you not revive us again, that*ld your people may rejoice in you?
Show*ln us your unfailing love, Lord,*s and*ld grant us your salvation.
I*pn will listen to what God the Lord*s says; he*ld promises peace to his people, his faithful servantsâ€” but*ld let them not turn to folly.
Surely*ln his salvation is near those who fear him, that*ld his glory may dwell in our land.
Love*pn and faithfulness meet together; righteousness*ld and peace kiss each other.
Faithfulness*ln springs forth from the earth, and*ld righteousness looks down from heaven.
The*ln Lord*s will indeed give what is good, and*ld our land will yield its harvest.
Righteousness*ln goes before him and*ld prepares the way for his steps.
